intro: Macromeles formosana, commonly known as the Formosan macaranga, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually heart-shaped. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the genus Macaranga. It is often found in lowland and mountainous forest areas, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Macromeles formosana plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
